body.name: Blue Yeti USB Microphone, Silver (Renewed)
body.stockDetail: Only 14 left in stock - order soon.
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Tuesday, February 20. Order within 14 hrs 14 mins
features: This Certified Refurbished product is tested and certified to look and work like new. The refurbishing process includes functionality testing, basic cleaning, inspection, and repackaging. The product ships with all relevant accessories, a minimum 90-day warranty, and may arrive in a generic box. Only select sellers who maintain a high performance bar may offer Certified Refurbished products on Amazon.com
Tri-capsule array - 3 condenser capsules can record almost any situation.
Multiple pattern selection - cardioid, bidirectional, omnidirectional & stereo
Gain control, mute button, zero-latency headphone output. Requires a minimum of 64 MB of RAM

Perfect for vocals, musical instruments, podcasting, voiceovers, interviews, field recordings, conference calls; Plug ‘n play – Mac OS X (10.4.11 or higher) and PC (Windows 8.1, 8, 7, Vista, XP). Bit Rate: 16bit
body.description: Create unparalleled recordings directly in your computer with Blue Microphone's Yeti USB Microphone. The Yeti uses Blue Microphone's proprietary tri-capsule technology to produce pristine, studio-quality recordings. It features four different pattern settings so you can record vocals, instrumental music, podcasts, or interviews in ways that would normally require multiple microphones. With simple controls for headphone volume, pattern selection, instant mute, and microphone gain, you'll be creating exceptional recordings right out of the box.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Finally, a USB microphone that works for me
reviews.reviewText: I've had bad luck getting external mics to work for the webinars I do. This one has been working for weeks, and really stepped up my sound quality. It's bigger than it looks in the pictures, so do be aware of that, but the size isn't a problem for me. Sound quality is good, ease of use is great.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very good quality for the price
reviews.reviewText: I ordered this microphone refurbished and it works very well. My only gripe is that it came with a little bit of cosmetic damage on the stand (picture attached). It's no big deal or anything though. I'm very happy with my purchase.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2020
reviews.reviewText: Love this microphone. I got this to support conferencing such as Google Hangout, Zoom etc. I have used it on my Mac Mini, my Windows Laptop, and Chromebook. Works well on all three. Sound the other end of the wire is awesome. Yes it is definitely best if you yak close up to the thing, but it also is pretty good even at a distance. The retro look is very cool, and it is very stable and does not pick up too much vibration through the base. Overall I rate this 5 star, two thumbs up. Glad I bought this instead of the smaller siblings. Worth it for business use as well as games, and social. With the current social distancing, do yourself stand out from the crowd and don't sound like a turkey on the internet! Definitely recommended.BYTW, this Yeti was refurbished. Like new.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars An excellent mic if you're able to afford it
reviews.reviewText: Before I bought this microphone, I only used headset mics while talking with friends online, but eventually I decided that I don't want to keep getting entirely new headsets every time either the earphones or the mic goes bad. I wanted to get a desk microphone that would last, and after over 2 months of using this one nearly daily, it's working just fine. It has plenty of settings to adjust to whatever your needs may be, the only downside being that you probably can't just plug this in and go; you will need to find out what settings work best for you. I would also recommend getting a different sort of mount for it; although the standard base that comes with the mic is well made, it can get in the way while gaming and it picks up every keystroke and mouse click if you don't have your sensitivity low enough.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Reconditioned as new not accurate
reviews.reviewText: Tried two of them. Both had severe chips or scratches to the paint. One had stripped screws. Neither had original USB cables. One had severe humming regardless of gain adjustment I own two new ones and thought I could try a reconditioned as new. Returned both

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 27, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Works well, good sound. Hope it lasts longer than the first one (about 2 years)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great quality microphone for the money!
reviews.reviewText: I teach in higher education and have used a Blue Yeti microphone at work. When we transitioned to fully online classes in Spring 2020 due to the Covid19 pandemic I decided to by my own for my home office. Durable, sturdy, great sound quality for recording voice for instructional videos and live meetings/class sessions with students. Seamless connection and easy to use. I also have a daughter who wants to pursue a career in music. This spring we used the Blue Yeti microphone for her virtual recital and it worked great for that to. The gain setting is useful for family Zoom calls with grandparents - I can boost the gain (sensitivity) so quieter children can be heard.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Its the cable for you Mac Users
reviews.reviewText: At first I could not figure out why it did not show up in System Preference (Device Manager for Windows users) so I did a search others had similar problems. Until I spotted a you Tube video that a fellow was having on his iMac. He swapped a cable but did not explain why. So I searched found a smaller USB cable this one was small a 12" one and voila it showed up as Yeti Stereo Microphone. We found another one about half as long as the original and it to also worked. So if any Mac user or even a Windows user is having a problem for the device to initialize try swapping a smaller length cable. I think there may be a voltage drop in the longer length cable that may cause problems for the computer to pick up the signal. -- Lou Cioccio
El micrófono capta justo los sonidos que quieres (ya configurado con ghub)Y tiene una gran variedad de configuraciones

reviews.reviewTitle: Great mic, I m pretty satisfied.
reviews.reviewText: Mine is a renewed product, it's a good mic for beginners like me, I think the noise cancellation worked really nice and fine. It cancelled lot of background noise, of course you need to have quite room for recording, that's a prerequisite. The sound quality too was quite well recorded, I have bought this mic to record my son's song, it did a pretty decent job, wanted to go for XLR but the problem was I was tight on a budget, with XLR one would also have to pay for audio interface or mixer, and again a good XLR mic is not cheap such as Shure mics they sell at a premium. each and every item in the pic have been bought from Amazon over a period of time. I found the renewed Yeti mic good for the price, wanted to go for a new one but the price is too high and I don't think the price of the new one needs to be this high 12500/-. I hope my renewed does not go dead, I want this much to work for years to come. I found the cable supplied with the mic to be a cheap one Selling the new mic for 12500/- the company should make sure to supply premium quality cable, also the mini usb port and the audio jack port was poorly placed, no quality work there. After going through all the reviews majority of those reviews complained about the cheap cable and the poor quality of placement of ports. I did register the product on the blue website.

reviews.reviewTitle: Funciona perfecto y se ve genial
reviews.reviewText: No le encuentro ningún fallo ni defecto, funciona y se escucha perfectamente y, en su apariencia, ninguna falta de pintura o o signo de que haya sido usado. Encima, en mi caso, llegó la versión Blackout que es muy bonita. Hay gente que no tuvo misma suerte, pero, dado la opción de poder devolverlo, recomiendo muchísimo comprarlo, probarlo y juzgar, ya que, en caso de que os llegue igual que a mí, es un auténtico bombazo. Estoy muy contento.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nos ahorramos horas de limpiar audio
reviews.reviewText: Habíamos grabado con un micrófono de solopa y aceptábamos la calidad decente, y que limpiar audio era parte de la chamba, luego compramos este micrófono y nos olvidamos de eso, debí comprarlo antes. Nos ahorramos horas de trabajo, de esfuerzo porque bloquea sonidos externos, incluso sonidos de carros y camiones de la calle.Un profesional actor de doblaje me había dicho de esta marca y fue mi modelo de entrada. Si quieren calidad y buen precio, éste es ideal. Si lo que buscan es que tenga lucecitas porque graban podcast de esos de gente blanca que opina desde su privilegio y hace afirmaciones gratuitas, pues compren otro. Pero si son profesionales, compren este micrófono.Desventajas: es pesado si lo traes en la mochila, pero aguanta caidas. Igual no lo tiren.
Capta perfectamente el sonido y es fácil conectarlo al PC
